p: As for taste, Psidium guineense Sw. and C. rufa were highlighted. The species perceived as the least tasty was Talisia cf. macrophylla (Mart.) Radlk. The interviewees indicated P. guineense and A. coriacea as the most easily propagated plants, while Syagrus cearensis Noblick was considered the most difficult species to propagate. D. trifida and A. coriacea were regarded as the plant species with the greatest nutritional potential whereas Syzygium cumini (L.) Skeels was the species with the least potential.
